hanzi-su-wiki:
餅

Значения

Рисовые лепешки, «моти»

Мнемоника

Рисовые лепешки, еда 食 из толченого 并 зерна.

Варианты

餠, 饼

round flat cake; cookie; cake; pastry; Classifiers: 张
круглая лепешка; cookie; торт; выпечка; Классификаторы: 张
rtega_mnemonic:
餅餅RS
饼饼		rice-cakes, biscuits, anything round and flat
  • something edible 飠 which looks equal from both sides 并
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 饼)
Pictophonetic: 并 indicates the sound; 飠 (food) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 餅乾 [ bǐng gān ]: biscuit; cracker; cookie; Classifiers: 片
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 飠 [ shí ] food; to eat
    • 并 [ bìng ] to combine, to annex; also, what's more
heisig_chinese_memo: A cookie is food which puzzles you when you try to think about how they made the cool designs and shapes. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: mochi, eat, food, umbrella, good, halo, drop, silver, puzzle, horns, two hands
heisig_story: Mochi is the glutinous rice the Japanese pound into cakes. Its primitives are: food . . . puzzle.
koohiiStory1: Call your friend and he answers the phone "Mochi, mochi!" whatever he is eating sure is making it hard to understand. I will puzzle over the content of our conversation for some time to come.
koohiiStory2: Mochi ice cream is a puzzling food, I still have no idea how they get that ice cream in there, but it sure tastes good.
Ru_AutoNotes: Японская лепёшка, сделанная из истолчённого в пасту клейкого риса особого сорта мотигомэ и раскатанная в форму. Бывают моти с начинкой (сладости), мороженое с моти, сладкий суп из моти.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, ノ, 二 (два), 并, 廾 (двадцать), 食 (еда)
Ru_trainchinese: bǐng: (сущ) круглая лепешка, блин; предмет в форме плоской лепешки
Kanshudo_mnemonic: what you combine (并) and eat (𩙿) is mochi
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Great food gift idea - get someone a puzzle made from cookies.  When they finish the puzzle they can unwrap each cookie one by one and eat the cookies until the puzzle disappears.  How much fun is that!?
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " food " and " combined ", the original meaning is roasted or steamed pasta, and then specifically refers to oblate food made of flour, rice noodles, etc. "Shuowen": "Noodles and rice cakes. From food, and sound simultaneously." "Mozi·Gengzhu": "When you see people make cakes, you still steal them."

" Bing " can be used as a verb to mean making a cake. The Northern Wei Dynasty Jia Sixie "Qi Min Yao Shu‧ Fajiu": "Dry dampness to deliberate. Three thousand and six hundred pestles are pounded in Japan, and they are made into cakes." Shi Shenghan's note: "Make cakes."

" Bing " can also mean pie. "The Great View of the Wild History of the Qing Dynasty‧The Narrative of the Differences in the Qing Dynasty‧The Rape and Murder of Zhao Situ": "Calling out the children to worship, Zhao Yiyi gave bread.

" Bing " can be further blurred into a quantifier to quantify the pie. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-The Biography of the Female Daughters-Le Yangzi's Wife": "The sheep who tried to walk on the road, got a loaf of gold, and returned it to his wife."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " food " and " combined ", the original meaning is baked or steamed pasta, and then specifically refers to oblate food made of flour, rice noodles, etc.
humanum_full_description:
從「食」，「并」聲，本義為烤熟或蒸熟的麵食，後專指扁圓形的用麵粉、米粉等做成的食品。《說文》：「麪餈也。从食，并聲。」 《墨子‧耕柱》：「見人之作餅，則還然竊之。」

　　「餅」可用作動詞，表示製作餅食。北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧法酒》：「燥濕以意酌之。日中擣三千六百杵，訖，餅之。」石聲漢注：「作成餅。」

　　「餅」也可表示餅狀物。《清朝野史大觀‧清代述異‧趙四圖姦兇殺案》：「呼子女出拜，趙一一賜以餅金。」

　　「餅」還可進一步虛化為量詞，用以量化餅狀物。《後漢書‧列女傳‧樂羊子妻》：「羊子嘗行路，得遺金一餅，還以與妻。」
humanum_short_description: 從「食」，「并」聲，本義為烤熟或蒸熟的麵食，後專指扁圓形的用麵粉、米粉等做成的食品。

餅(もち): sticky rice cake

從「 食 」，「 并 」聲，本義為烤熟或蒸熟的麵食，後專指扁圓形的用麵粉、米粉等做成的食品。《說文》：「麪餈也。从食，并聲。」 《墨子‧耕柱》：「見人之作餅，則還然竊之。」 「 餅 」可用作動詞，表示製作餅食。北魏賈思勰《齊民要術‧法酒》：「燥濕以意酌之。日中擣三千六百杵，訖，餅之。」石聲漢注：「作成餅。」 「 餅 」也可表示餅狀物。《清朝野史大觀‧清代述異‧趙四圖姦兇殺案》：「呼子女出拜，趙一一賜以餅金。」 「 餅 」還可進一步虛化為量詞，用以量化餅狀物。《後漢書‧列女傳‧樂羊子妻》：「羊子嘗行路，得遺金一餅，還以與妻。」
From the sound of " food" and " combined", the original meaning is roasted or steamed pasta, and then specifically refers to oblate food made of flour, rice noodles, etc. "Shuowen": "Noodles and rice cakes. From food, and sound simultaneously." "Mozi·Gengzhu": "When you see people make cakes, you still steal them." " Bing" can be used as a verb to mean making a cake. The Northern Wei Dynasty Jia Sixie "Qi Min Yao Shu‧ Fajiu": "Dry dampness to deliberate. Three thousand and six hundred pestles are pounded in Japan, and they are made into cakes." Shi Shenghan's note: "Make cakes." " Bing" can also mean pie. "The Great View of the Wild History of the Qing Dynasty‧The Narrative of the Differences in the Qing Dynasty‧The Rape and Murder of Zhao Situ": "Calling out the children to worship, Zhao Yiyi gave bread. " Bing" can be further blurred into a quantifier to quantify the pie. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty-The Biography of the Female Daughters-Le Yangzi's Wife": "The sheep who tried to walk on the road, got a loaf of gold, and returned it to his wife."

Examples: 餅 (もち)
一 (один), ｜, ノ, 二 (два), 并, 廾 (двадцать), 食 (еда)

Японская лепёшка, сделанная из истолчённого в пасту клейкого риса особого сорта мотигомэ и раскатанная в форму. Бывают моти с начинкой (сладости), мороженое с моти, сладкий суп из моти.
